Injera.name: Injera
steps: combine the teff flour and active dry yest using your hand in large bowl.
cover it with a plastic wrap
Add the self-rising flour and up to 1 cup of water a little at a time.
Cover again and let sit for 1 hour
whisk 1 teaspoon salt into the batter
pour 1/4 cup of the batter in the skillet
when the injera is is about3/4 of the way cooked , cover the skillet and let steam for 1 minute.
once the edges are dry lift it from the pan
repeat with the remaining batter

CabbageDish.name: Cabbage Dish
steps: Heat the olive olive oil in a 6.5-quart covered stockpot over medium high heat.
Toss in the carrots and onion and saute them in the oil for about 5 minutes
stir in the seasonings(salt ,pepper, cumin,turmeric,ginger) and toast for a minute
Add in the cabbage and potatoes.stir to combine.
cover the pan. Reduce the heat to medium-low.Cook until the potatoes are soft, about 30 minutes

Shiro-Wat.name: Shiro Wat
steps: heat stockpot to medium heat.Add pureed onions to the dry pan and saute until they becoome dry and start to take on color about 4-5 minutes
Add the oil and berbere spice.Salute for 1-2 minutes until fragrant
Next Add tomato and chopped garlic .Salute for 2-3 minutes more
Add in the cabbage and potatoes.stir to combine.
cover the pan. Reduce the heat to medium-low.Cook until the potatoes are soft, about 30 minutes
Now start whisking in about half of the chickpea flour.
Gradually start to add about 1 cup of water. Whisk in the remaining chickpea flour and an additional 1 cup of water.
Whisk until mixture is very smooth. Add remaining Â½ cup of water if you prefer your shiro a little thinner.
Heat until the shiro begins to pop (simmer). Then add the niter kibbeh, garlic powder, sugar, and salt to taste, stirring until combined.
Simmer for about 5-10 minutes over low heat until the flavors combine and the oil separates slightly from the shiro.
Garnish with jalepeno, if desired.Serve with fresh injera.

CollardGreens.name: CollardGreens
steps: Heat niter kibbeh in a pan over medium high heat.
Add the onion and cook until soft and translucent, 5-7 minutes.
Add the garlic, ginger and spices and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add the collard greens and another tablespoon of niter kibbeh and cook until the collards turn bright green and are wilted but still a slightly crispy, 5-7 minutes.
Add more spices and/or niter kibbeh to taste.
Garnish with jalepeno, if desired.Serve with fresh injera.
